document.title: Illinois Learning Standards for Physical Development and Health

A3290D20DFE5013183FC68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate basic refusal skills (e.g., "Just Say No", "Stranger Danger").

A328CAC0DFE5013183FB68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate skills essential to enhancing health and avoiding dangerous situations.

A3288600DFE5013183FA68A86D17958E.description: Recognize how choices can affect health (e.g., not brushing/tooth decay, smoking/risk of cancer and heart disease).

A32833F0DFE5013183F968A86D17958E.description: Apply decision-making skills related to the protection and promotion of individual health.

A327DAF0DFE5013183F868A86D17958E.description: Identify positive verbal and nonverbal communication skills (e.g., body language, manners, listening).

A3278A40DFE5013183F768A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between positive and negative behaviors (e.g., waiting your turn vs. pushing in line, honesty vs. lying).

A3274100DFE5013183F668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate procedures for communicating in positive ways, resolving differences and preventing conflict.

comments: From an early age, students need to know how to communicate their health needs and learn to take responsibility for their own health. They also need to know how and why personal decisions can affect their own health and well-being. Consideration for the needs of others becomes part of health promotion as well. Students who can clearly identify and communicate about health-related issues-and can make healthful personal decisions-will benefit as they grow and mature in school and into responsible workers and citizens.
A326D6B0DFE5013183F568A86D17958E.description: Promote and enhance health and well-being through the use of effective communication and decision-making skills.

A3267640DFE5013183F468A86D17958E.description: Identify individual differences in growth and development among people.

A3262E20DFE5013183F368A86D17958E.description: Describe factors that affect growth and development.

A325EB20DFE5013183F268A86D17958E.description: Identify healthy actions that influence the functions of the body (e.g., cleanliness, proper diet, exercise).

A3259FC0DFE5013183F168A86D17958E.description: Explain the effects of health-related actions on the body systems.

A32554F0DFE5013183F068A86D17958E.description: Identify basic parts of body systems and their functions (e.g., heart, lungs, eyes).

A3251170DFE5013183EF68A86D17958E.description: Describe and explain the structure and functions of the human body systems and how they interrelate.

A324BF40DFE5013183EE68A86D17958E.description: Understand human body systems and factors that influence growth and development.
comments: To achieve healthful individual development, students need to understand human anatomy and physiology, nutrition, stages of growth and development, avoidance of harmful actions and the characteristics of good health habits. Early learners begin with basic recognition of body systems and growth stages. As students progress, they understand how systems work together and how individual actions affect health. As they themselves grow and develop, students can learn to enhance the process throughout their school years and later life.

A32477C0DFE5013183ED68A86D17958E.description: Identify sources and causes of environmental health risks (e.g., air, soil, sun, water, noise, food, chemicals).

A3243750DFE5013183EC68A86D17958E.description: Explain how the environment can affect health.

A323F4C0DFE5013183EB68A86D17958E.description: Encourage and support others in making positive health choices (e.g., eating practices, cleanliness, safety practices).

A323B590DFE5013183EA68A86D17958E.description: Describe and explain the factors that influence health among individuals, groups and communities.

A32373E0DFE5013183E968A86D17958E.description: Identify dangerous situations and safety methods to reduce risks (e.g., traffic, improper use of medicine and poisons, strangers).

A3231F30DFE5013183E868A86D17958E.description: Identify methods of health promotion and illness prevention (e.g., obtaining immuni-zations, hand washing, brushing and flossing teeth, eating practices, sleep, cleanliness).

A322C4A0DFE5013183E768A86D17958E.description: Identify general signs and symptoms of illness (e.g., fever, rashes, coughs, congestion).

A3227540DFE5013183E668A86D17958E.description: Explain the basic principles of health promotion, illness prevention and safety.

A3222BC0DFE5013183E568A86D17958E.description: Understand principles of health promotion and the prevention and treatment of illness and injury.
comments: Nutrition, exercise, rest, hygiene and safety are the bases for personal, family and occupational health. From an early age, students can recognize healthy habits and understand why they are important. As students become more sophisticated in their understanding, they learn and can adopt a variety of ways to minimize illness and enhance health. Learners will be able to apply the effects of health-related actions to success in the workplace. Students who develop an effective understanding of basic health promotion can establish the foundation for achieving and maintaining personal health and well-being by making informed wellness decisions now and throughout their lives.

A321E8A0DFE5013183E468A86D17958E.description: Work cooperatively with another to accomplish an assigned task.

A321A240DFE5013183E368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate cooperative skills during structured group physical activity.

A32145E0DFE5013183E268A86D17958E.description: Work independently on tasks for short periods of time.

A320F290DFE5013183E168A86D17958E.description: Use identified procedures and safe practices with little or no reinforcement during group physical activities.

A320A750DFE5013183E068A86D17958E.description: Follow directions and class procedures while participating in physical activities.

A3206640DFE5013183DF68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate individual responsibility during group physical activities.

A32020D0DFE5013183DE68A86D17958E.description: Develop team-building skills by working with others through physical activity.
comments: As members of teams, students need to fill the role of leader at times and participant at other times. Knowing how to follow procedures, accept leadership from others, participate actively and lead when appropriate will serve the student on and off the playing field. Students need to know the elements of teamwork (communication, decision making, cooperation, leadership) and how to adjust individual needs to team needs. Students also need to be able to recognize each member's contributions, including their own.

A31F98B0DFE5013183DC68A86D17958E.description: Set goals based on fitness data and develop, implement and monitor an individual fitness improvement plan.

A31F3C80DFE5013183DB68A86D17958E.description: Describe immediate effects of physical activity on the body (e.g., faster heartbeat, increased pulse rate, increased breathing rate).

A31EBF80DFE5013183D968A86D17958E.description: Engage in sustained physical activity that causes increased heart rate, muscle strength and range of movement.

A31E7D20DFE5013183D868A86D17958E.description: Identify characteristics of health-related fitness (e.g., flexibility, muscular strength).

A31E3AC0DFE5013183D768A86D17958E.description: Know and apply the principles and components of health-related fitness.

A31DF140DFE5013183D668A86D17958E.description: Achieve and maintain a health-enhancing level of physical fitness based upon continual self-assessment.
comments: Regular physical activity is necessary to sustain fitness and health. Students need to apply training principles-frequency, intensity, time and type (FITT)-to achieve their personal fitness goals. Fitness expectations need to be established on an individual basis; realistic goals need to be based on the health-related components of endurance, strength, flexibility, cardiorespiratory fitness and body composition. By learning and applying these concepts, students can develop lifelong understanding and good habits for overall health and fitness.

A31DA670DFE5013183D568A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate safe movement in physical activities.

A31D5450DFE5013183D468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate knowledge of rules, safety and strategies during physical activity.

A31D0AE0DFE5013183D368A86D17958E.description: Understand spatial awareness and relationships to objects and people.

A31CC120DFE5013183D268A86D17958E.description: Analyze various movement concepts and applications.

A31C7C10DFE5013183D168A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate control when performing fundamental locomotor, non-locomotor and manipulative skills.

A31C3660DFE5013183D068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate physical competency in individual and team sports, creative movement and leisure and work-related activities.

A31BE640DFE5013183CF68A86D17958E.description: Acquire movement skills and understand concepts needed to engage in health-enhancing physical activity.
comments: Physical performance involves competency in a wide range of motor, non-motor and manipulative skills. Learning in this area is developmental, building simple movements into more complex patterns. Learning to follow directions and rules enhances enjoyment and success in both recreational and competitive sports. Working toward higher levels of competence, students learn how to maintain health and fitness as individuals and as members of teams.
